intro: Psychotria letestui, commonly known as the Letestu's Psychotria, is a species of flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Central and South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves and produces clusters of small, white or pale yellow flowers. It is often found in moist, shaded environments such as rainforests and undergrowth. Psychotria letestui is also noted for its potential ethnobotanical significance, though its medicinal properties remain under study.
